channel.title: Documentation on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: How to export a PDF from Capture and PCB Editor
item.description:
Introduction

This tutorial goes through how to save CIS schematics and PCB layers as a PDF.

item.title: Interrupts on PSoC
item.description: An interrupt is a signal received by a microcontroller and emitted by hardware or software that is signaling a system event that needs immediate attention. Interrupts are useful to avoid constant monitoring of electronic peripherals (e.g., sensors).

item.title: PSoC 4 Hardware Development Kits
item.description: There are several Cypress Programmable System on a Chip (PSoC®) hardware development kits available for use in designs. The list below describes strengths of each kit and provides links to documentation.

item.title: What is PSoC?
item.description: The Cypress Programmable System on a Chip (PSoC®) is a mixed-signal electronic hardware platform that integrates a microcontroller core, programmable analog signal processing blocks, programmable digital hardware blocks, and capacitive touch sensing. The following is a list of helpful resources for getting started with the PSoC®:
